tool.name: MACS2 bdgdiff
tool.description: Differential peak detection based on paired four bedgraph files
tool.command:
macs2 bdgdiff --t1 '${ t1 }' --t2 '${ t2 }' --c1 '${ c1 }' --c2 '${ c2 }' --cutoff '${ cutoff }' --min-len '${ minlen }' --depth1 '${ depth.depth1 }' --depth2 '${ depth.depth2 }' --max-gap '${ maxgap }' -o c1.bed c2.bed both.bed &&
awk '!/^track name/' "c1.bed" > '${ output_cond1 }' && awk '!/^track name/' "c2.bed" > '${ output_cond1 }' && awk '!/^track name/' "both.bed" > '${ output_both }'

param.name: cutoff
param.label: Cutoff of log10 likelihood ratio cutoff
param.help: Default=1.0 correspoinding to likelihood ratio of 1,000 (--cutoff)

param.name: minlen
param.label: Minimum length of differential region
param.help: Try bigger value to remove small regions. Default=200 (--min-len)

section.name: depth
section.title: Sequencing depth
section.help: Sequencing depths will be used to calculate scaling factor for each sample, to down-scale larger sample to the level of smaller one. For example, while comparing condition 1 (10 Million reads) and condition 2 (20 million reads), use --depth1 10 --depth2 20, then pileup value in bedGraph for condition 2 will be divided by 2.

param.name: depth1
param.label: Sequence depth of condition 1 in million reads

param.name: depth2
param.label: Sequence depth of condition 2 in million reads

param.name: maxgap
param.label: Maximum gap to merge nearby differential regions
param.help: Consider a wider gap for broad marks. Maximum gap should be smaller than minimum length. Default=100 (--max-gap).

tool.help:
**What it does**
This is **bdgdiff** utility from the MACS2_ Package. It performs differential peak detection based on paired four bedgraph files.
.. _MACS2: https://github.com/taoliu/MACS
@citation@
